            Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
            
              I am currently an assistant professor of sociology and a core faculty member at the Minority Health Disparities Initiative at the University of Nebraska - Lincoln.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
          About
          Research
          Teaching
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Research
          
          
            
              I am a Gerontologist that studies Latina/o/x aging and health. The primary objective of my research is to inform efforts aimed at reducing race/ethnic health inequalities that characterize our growing older adult population. Specifically, I am interested in identifying how residential environments and sociocultural processes “get under the skin” to influence health by elucidating the complex association between neighborhood conditions, sociocultural factors, psychosocial factors, and physiological precursors to disease and functional health decline among Latinos.
            
            
              I am a Gerontologist that studies Latina/o/x aging and health. The primary objective of my research is to inform efforts aimed at reducing race/ethnic health inequalities that characterize our growing older adult population. Specifically, I am interested in identifying how residential environments and sociocultural processes “get under the skin” to influence health by elucidating the complex association between neighborhood conditions, sociocultural factors, psychosocial factors, and physiological precursors to disease and functional health decline among Latinos.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
          About
          Research
          Teaching
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Teaching
          
          
            
              My teaching background has largely centered on teaching quantitative methods in the social sciences and my overarching goal is to give students the tools to understand the world they live in by teaching them sociological and gerontological approaches to formulating research questions and research designs that can answer those questions. I use Bloom’s taxonomy of learning as a framework to design all of my courses because I want students to engage with course material in a dynamic classroom, whether in-person or online.
            
            
              My teaching background has largely centered on teaching quantitative methods in the social sciences and my overarching goal is to give students the tools to understand the world they live in by teaching them sociological and gerontological approaches to formulating research questions and research designs that can answer those questions. I use Bloom’s taxonomy of learning as a framework to design all of my courses because I want students to engage with course material in a dynamic classroom, whether in-person or online.
